abstract: Benchmarking and surveying tool-integrated reasoning agents (Agent0, tool-learning surveys, multi-agent LLM systems, and reasoning/action integration).

source_papers.reference: Agent0: Unleashing Self-Evolving Agents from Zero Data via Tool-Integrated Reasoning (arXiv:2511.16043)
source_papers.justification: Primary reference on tool-integrated reasoning and self-evolving agents.

source_papers.reference: LLM-Based Agents for Tool Learning: A Survey
source_papers.justification: Survey of tool-learning patterns and challenges for LLM agents.
source_papers.usage: Context and taxonomy for tool-learning strategies.

source_papers.reference: A Survey on LLM-based Multi-Agent Systems: Workflow, Infrastructure, and Challenges
source_papers.justification: Survey of multi-agent workflows and infra considerations.
source_papers.usage: Guidance on multi-agent orchestration and infra.

source_papers.reference: On Evaluating the Integration of Reasoning and Action in LLM Agents

task1: Design a concise evaluation plan for tool-integrated LLM agents (single- and multi-agent) covering reasoning + action loops, tool-learning workflows, and evaluation metrics. Deliver: (1) a list of 5-8 high-value reference codebases or papers; (2) a compact plan for experiments (benchmarks, metrics for reasoning/action integration, ablations). Keep it practical and runnable on CPU; prefer Python/PyTorch codebases.
task2: Identify pain points and open challenges in tool-integrated and multi-agent LLM systems (data, infra, safety), and propose a prioritized roadmap (short-term quick wins vs. medium-term improvements).
